title: Data Scientist
description: Competition # : 38823Department: Health and WellnessLocation: HALIFAXType of Employment: PermanentUnion Status:  Exclusion - Non Union - NSPGClosing Date: 5/5/2023 ( Applications are accepted until 11:59 PM Atlantic Time)About UsThe Department of Health and Wellness offers opportunities to grow and advance in a dynamic sector that touches the lives of all Nova Scotians. Along with our partners, including Nova Scotia Health and the IWK Health Centre, we’re committed to continually improving our health care system. With a focus on collaborative primary health care, continuing care, improved supports for mental health and addictions, digital health, capital infrastructure, and more, the department is thinking differently about how to plan, fund, legislate and monitor to improve access and service delivery. To do this, we need leaders at all levels of the organization who embrace a challenge and believe in their ability to make a difference.About Our OpportunityThe Department of Health and Wellness is expanding its policy development and strategic planning capacity through an increased use of advanced analytics to drive insight and to incorporate a broader use of varied data resources. This position will take a leadership role in expanding the Department’s capabilities in this area, with a particular focus on health economics.Primary AccountabilitiesReporting to the Director of Analytics, you will work with a dynamic, collegial and committed team that provides analytical and applied research services to ensure capacity for driving change. You will lead data-driven projects, applying advanced econometric and analytical methodologies at every stage: data exploration, design and evaluation of methods and models; and communicate results to internal and external stakeholders.You will strengthen the use of advanced econometrics to inform strategic planning and policy development, responding to the health needs of Nova Scotians and aligning with the overall strategic vision and mission of the Department.You will expand not only the Department’s capabilities, but advance strategy on data analytics, and the use of new sources of information. You will use advanced analytics technologies to leverage structured and unstructured data from a variety of internal and external sources. You will find creative ways to develop tools and services that drive innovation.As a Data Scientist, You Will Also Act as a subject matter expert in the areas of economic data science, advanced analytics, econometric methods, and new analytics technologies  Apply, adapt and design computational architectures and approaches for the statistical analysis of health data  Leverage extensive theoretical and practical knowledge of advanced analytic methods and algorithms  Keep current with industry and academic developments  Apply data visualization techniques to present the results of statistical analysis  Play a key role in applied health economic research projects linked to the provincial health system  Support the development of a broader health economics strategy and capability in collaboration with internal stakeholders and external partners  Work in collaboration with Analytics Team members, seeking and providing feedback on work under development.  Work with a team of analysts to foster their professional development.. Qualifications And ExperienceA completed Master’s degree or Ph.D. in economics or a related discipline such as computer science, mathematics, or statistics with at least 5 years of recent relevant experience related to economics, including experience leading project teams.An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered. Applicants relying on education and experience equivalencies must demonstrate such equivalencies in their application.We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist, specialized in econometrics, who has excellent analytical research and problem-solving skills, enjoys working in an innovation environment, and is a self-starter.As a Successful Data Scientist (Economics), You Are an effective communicator who can share and adapt information and ideas to the target audience, using clear and compelling written and oral communication skills;  Possess knowledge and experience in collecting, organizing and manipulating large data sets;  Have hands-on experience with statistical and quantitative analysis, scientific programming languages and libraries, and data visualization tools.  Are able to demonstrate your experience with advanced analytics projects, including designing methodologies, conducting analysis and interpreting results. Considered An Asset If You Have Knowledge of health systems, health economics, health policy, and/or population health The Government of Nova Scotia has adopted the LEADS Leadership Framework. During the interview, candidates will be expected to express how they have demonstrated the key behaviours and capabilities required to effectively lead in a caring and inclusive environment. LEADS Domains includes Leads Self, Engage Others, Achieve Results, Develop Coalitions and Systems Transformation.Please follow LEADS (novascotia.ca) for more information.We will assess the above qualifications and competencies using one or more of the following tools: written examination, standardized tests, oral presentations, interview(s), and reference checks.EquivalencyAn equivalent combination of training, education and experience will be considered. Applicants relying on education and experience equivalencies must demonstrate such equivalencies in their application.Benefitsthe Government of Nova Scotia offers its employees a wide range of benefits such as Health, Dental, Life Insurance, Pension, General Illness (Short and Long Term), Vacation and Employee and Family Assistance Programs. Click here to learn more about our various benefits offerings and eligibility criteria.What We Offer Career Development where you have access to career guidance, tools, resources, and ongoing training for every stage of your career.  Engaging workplace. Our Employees feel valued, respected, connected, and tuned in. We have forward-thinking policies and strategies.  Countless Career Paths.  Department Specific Flexible working schedules. Pay Grade: EC 13Salary Range: $3,804.02 - $4,755.01 Bi-WeeklyEmployment Equity StatementOur goal is to be a diverse workforce that is representative, at all job levels, of the citizens we serve. The Government of Nova Scotia has an Employment Equity Policy, and we welcome applications from Indigenous People, African Nova Scotians and Other Racially Visible Persons, Persons with Disabilities and Women in occupations or positions where they are under-represented. If you are a member of one of these equity groups, you are encouraged to self-identify on your electronic application.Current government employees may access this posting through the link below:Offer of employment is conditional upon the completion of all applicable background checks and confirmation of credentials, the results of which must be satisfactory to the employer. We thank all applicants for the interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. All questions and concerns may be directed to Competitions@novascotia.ca.

title: Data Scientist - Marketing Measurement & Optimization
description: Position Overview:We are looking for a strategic, collaborative, and highly analytical individual to join our Analytics and Data Science team, to work on media measurement, forecasting and optimization. ShyftLabs is a growing data product company that was founded in early 2020, and works primarily with Fortune 500 companies. We deliver digital solutions built to help accelerate the growth of businesses in various industries, by focusing on creating value through innovation.As a Data Scientist of Marketing Measurement & Optimization, you will be responsible for supporting the Marketing organization across a broad set of needs to help our marketers drive efficient customer acquisition and customer engagement/repeat purchase behaviour.The ideal candidate will be an analytical problem solver who gets excited about working with data in all capacities and would prefer to take the pragmatic approach rather than the theoretical one.To succeed, you’ll need strong independent thinking skills, coupled with the ability to lead the narrative on how to approach and solve key problems the business faces daily. While strong analytical acumen is a must, the ideal candidate must also be able to communicate data and insights to business users and package ideas/results into cohesive, strategic stories. This role requires strong business acumen and the ability to get up to speed quickly on retail omni-channel dynamics.Your job will be to build a marketing performance measurement model, design and run forecasting/optimization scenarios that facilitate decision making and allow a smart, savvy team of marketers to measure and optimize the coordinated power of their marketing and media efforts across key business goals.Job Responsibilities:Building statistical and predictive models to forecast, analyze, and measure the impact of paid, owned, and earned media across digital and offline channels in order to drive marketing strategies at omni channels.Empowering the marketing organization to refine their strategies, make more efficient budget allocations, and maximize their return on investment by building multi-channel performance measurement solutions.Providing analytics support both in the planning stages of campaign development (targeting, customer behaviour, performance benchmarking, etc.) and performance measurement/optimization stages.Connecting the dots across media channels, site behaviour, and customer transactions to evaluate the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and surface actionable recommendations to improve future performance.Running forecasting and optimization scenarios to facilitate decision making process in terms of budget planning, gap analysis and incremental budget allocation.Integrating forecasting process into reporting tools, tracking the forecasted performance vs. actual.Job Requirements:Experience in a Data centric role with at least 2 years of full-time experience with Data Analytics discipline.Master’s degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, Data Science or another quantitative field.Statistical and econometric modelling expertise.Data ETL and processing experience.Data Automation Skills And Experience.Experience and expertise on advanced analytic techniques such as machine learning, predictive modelling, and logistic regression.Experience in advertising effectiveness analysis, marketing mix modelling, multi-touch attribution and ROI measurement.Working knowledge of media planning/buying and campaign management is a plus.Knowledge and experience in using multiple third-party media platforms, such as Google Ads, Facebook Ads Manager etc.Dashboarding and data visualization experience.Excellent communication skills.Software/Tools Exposure:Big data tools –Spark SQL, Hive, Airflow etc.Cloud Technologies – Google Cloud Platform serviceProgramming and coding languages: R, SQL, PythonVisualization tools – Looker, Tableau or Power BI, Data Studio etc.We are proud to offer a competitive salary alongside a strong healthcare insurance and benefits package. The role is preferably hybrid, with 2 days per week spent in office. We pride ourselves on the growth of our employees, offering extensive learning and development resources.

title: Data Scientist - Hybrid
description: ROLE OBJECTIVE:Reporting to the Chief Analytics Officer, the Data Scientist is a vital part of modeling team who is responsible for developing machine-learning and statistical models for practical applications in different industries in order to deliver data driven insights supporting business objectives.SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES: Develop and fit statistical, mathematical programming, machine learning, or optimization models  Automate current legacy ETL, statistical modelling and QC processes  Write production model code in Python; collaborate with Software Engineers to implement algorithms in production  Contribute to data mining architecture, modeling standards and data analysis methodologies.  Acquire, explore, analyze, visualize, cleanse, and transform large sets of data from various external or internal sources.  Participate in the creation of technical documentation and knowledge shares QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIRED SKILLS:  Education – Master’s or PhD Degree in a quantitative field such as Operations Research, Data Science, Computer Science, Quantitative Finance, Math, Physics, or a related Engineering degree.  Experience Minimum three (3) years of experience in building models and developing algorithms for optimization, machine learning, statistics, mathematical programming, and simulation in industry or academia.  Expertise in Mixed Integer Programming, Linear Programming, and Constrained Optimization.  Very good proficiency in Python and hands-on skills in SQL  A demonstrated ability in Data Science or Operations Research, derived from hands-on experience working on multiple projects.  Deep understanding of statistics and probability, quantitative sciences, data analysis, predictive, statistical and ML modeling  End-to-end experience with data, including querying, aggregation, analysis, and visualization.  Strong problem-solving and communication skills; a bias towards taking action quickly, making things happen, learning and correcting course as you receive feedback  Analytical Skills – Effectively researches and synthesizes complex or diverse information; uses intuition and experience to complement data and designs work flows and procedures.  Judgment – Displays willingness to make timely decisions, including appropriate people in the decision-making process and exhibits sound and accurate judgment; supports and explains reasoning for decisions  Planning/Organizing – Prioritizes and plans work activities effectively. Ability to multi-task.  Teamwork – Balances team and individual responsibilities; Exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views, giving and welcoming feedback. Puts success of team above own interests and demonstrates ability to build morale and group commitments to goals and objectives. Supports everyone's efforts to succeed.  Innovation – Displays original thinking and creativity and meets challenges with resourcefulness. Generates suggestions for improving work. Presents ideas and information in a manner that gets others' agreement.  Communication Skills – Able to clearly communicate ideas and expectations. Effectively listens for understanding and asks questions for clarification. Presents ideas effectively in both verbal and written form.  Interpersonal Skills – Approachable and easy to talk to. Relates well to all kinds of people in the organization. Able to effectively build rapport with others. Uses diplomacy and tact. Maintains composure and shows an ability to resolve conflicts and gain agreement. About Environics Analytics Environics Analytics (EA) is a marketing services company specializing in geodemographic-based segmentation, site evaluation modelling, and custom analytics.  EA is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. If you require any accommodation to participate in the hiring process, please note the request in your application. We welcome people of all abilities.  At EA, you will solve meaningful and challenging tasks with a friendly team of the most brilliant minds. We hire personality, not just a pair of hands. Here you're free to express your unique qualities and explore different domains and technologies that interest you.

title: Data Scientist I
description: IGT (NYSE:IGT) is a global leader in gaming. We deliver entertaining and responsible gaming experiences for players across all channels and regulated segments, from Lotteries and Gaming Machines to Sports Betting and Digital. Leveraging a wealth of compelling content, substantial investment in innovation, player insights, operational expertise, and leading-edge technology, our solutions deliver unrivaled gaming experiences that engage players and drive growth. We have a well-established local presence and relationships with governments and regulators in more than 100 countries around the world, and create value by adhering to the highest standards of service, integrity, and responsibility. IGT has approximately 10,500 employees. For more information, please visit www.igt.com .Over viewIGT’s Center of Data Excellence is seeking a Data Scientist to research, design, and build innovative Analytics and Machine Learning (ML) solutions for the gaming industry. Working in close collaboration with our team of Data Engineers and Scientists, this role will also work in close collaboration with various business units to support data needs and data governance across many areas of IGT. It will have a large impact by performing innovative research studies and taking a hands-on, collaborative approach to implement the resulting outcomes.Responsibilities Work closely with other Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and Data Owners to gain a high understanding of our gaming related data and business objectives  Manipulate and optimize large volumes of data from a variety of sources.  Work within a cloud-based infrastructure (AWS or Azure or Google Cloud and Snowflake)  Turn data into valuable and actionable insights.  Work collaboratively to identify highest value target areas to apply advanced analytics, statistical modeling, data mining and to help research new predictive models, scoring algorithms, and other analytical methods  Design, implement, and test statistical algorithms into production warehouses and reports  Responsibilities include working with various business units and cloud accounts, managing, and optimizing data retrieval, administration and automation  Partner with software developers to design, implement, and test analytically-sound software and user interfaces Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in computer science, applied math, computer engineering, or related field with Specific courses in data engineering, data science, and/or data analysis.  Drive and enthusiasm for data science, cloud technologies, AI analysis & modeling tools, and/or machine learning. Willing to try new things and help build a data management framework.  Strong math skills, analytics, statistics, and ability to deal with anomalies are essential  An understanding of business - specifically knowledge of gaming industry is considered an asset  Experience with Python, SQL, snowflake, AWS Sagemaker, Jupyter notebooks, data ingestion, data management, data modeling, documentation, data governance and/or data analytics  Experience with MS products preferred.  Experience with data manipulation and SQL and tools such as Hadoop, Kafka, and Spark……  Working knowledge of expert data mining, machine learning and predictive modeling skills such as decision trees, Markov chains, regressions, time series analysis, CNN  Exposure to or experience working with big data warehouses that can run Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) processes on top of big data sets using cloud-based infrastructure such as AWS or Azure or Google Cloud or Snowflake.  Experience working with software development teams is a plus Keys to Success Building collaborative relationships Decision making Drive results Foster innovation Personal energy Self-leadershipIGT is committed to sustaining a workforce that reflects the diversity of the global customers and communities we serve, creating a fair and inclusive culture that enables all our employees to feel valued, respected and engaged. IGT is an equal opportunity employer. We provide equal opportunities without regard to sex, race, color, religion, age, national origin or ancestry, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information, gender identity or expression, marital or family status, and any other personal attributes protected by federal, provincial or other laws. We thank all applicants for applying; however, only those selected to interview will be contacted.IGT (NYSE: IGT) is the global leader in gaming. For more information, please visit www.igt.com .

title: MLOps Software Engineer
description: Two years ago, we embarked on a journey to start Haven Studios with a small team and big ambitions. Our goal was to build a studio where we could make the kind of games we’ve always wanted to create – and games we’ve longed to play. We are now part of the Playstation Studios family and are building exclusive new IP for Playstation as the first Sony game studio in Canada.We’ve made amazing progress in a short time thanks to our talented, passionate team and their exceptional contributions. We established a culture at Haven grounded in kindness, adaptability and courage that unlocks creativity. Our first new IP for PlayStation is on track to deliver a AAA multiplayer experience with a vision to build a systemic and evolving world focused on freedom, thrill, and playfulness that will keep players entertained and engaged for years.Position - MLOps software engineerWe are looking for an experienced software engineer to join the Generative Machine Learning team at Haven Studios. The ML researchers have been working closely with the game team, and you will play a key role integrating our development with the broader game development pipeline. You will own the architectural design of how we deploy ML to the broader game studio and implementation of necessary systems. You will work closely with the ML researchers and game developers to understand their requirements and build out the infrastructure that matches their needs.ReportingThe MLOps engineer will report to the Director of Generative ML.Responsibilities and DutiesArchitect and implement cloud-native solutions that connect our generative ML technologies to the game (using AWS, GCP)Build CI/CD pipelines to containerize, deploy, version, and monitor our generative modelsImprove development workflows for the ML teamBuild and maintain the REST APIs that expose our ML technology to the development teamExperience and skills requiredCloud platform experience (AWS, GCP, or Azure)Experience architecting, observing, and debugging production distributed systemsExperience with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, Ansible)Experience with container technologies (Docker, Kubernetes)Programming language experience with Python (Go, Rust an asset)Preferred qualificationsGood understanding of Linux and ML frameworks (PyTorch, CUDA )Experience with cloud-based GPUsExperience with distributed training in the cloudComfortable with rapid prototyping, fast iterations—---------Il y a 2 ans, nous nous sommes lancés dans la création de Haven Studios avec une petite équipe et de grandes ambitions. Notre objectif était de construire un studio où nous pourrions créer le genre de jeux que nous avons toujours voulu créer - et auxquels nous avons toujours rêvé de jouer ! Nous faisons désormais partie de la famille PlayStations Studios et nous sommes fiers d'avoir l'opportunité de créer une nouvelle propriété intellectuelle exclusive pour Playstation et de former la première équipe de développement Sony au Canada.Nous avons fait des progrès étonnants en peu de temps grâce à notre équipe talentueuse et passionnée et à ses contributions exceptionnelles. Nous avons instauré chez Haven une culture fondée sur la bienveillance, l'adaptabilité et le courage qui libère la créativité. Notre première nouvelle propriété intellectuelle pour PlayStation est sur la bonne voie pour offrir une expérience multijoueur de niveau AAA, avec la vision de construire un monde systémique et évolutif axé sur la liberté, le frisson et le jeu, qui gardera les joueur·euse·s diverti·e·s et engagé·e·s pendant des années.Poste - Ingénieur·e logiciel MLOpsNous recherchons un·e ingénieur·e logiciel expérimenté·e pour rejoindre l'équipe Machine Learning Génératif chez Haven Studios. Les chercheur·euse·s en ML travaillent en étroite collaboration avec l'équipe de jeu, et vous jouerez un rôle clé dans l'intégration de notre développement avec le pipeline de développement de jeu dans son ensemble. Vous serez responsable de la conception architecturale et de la manière dont nous déployons l'apprentissage automatique dans le studio de jeu ainsi que de l'implémentation des systèmes nécessaires. title: Machine Learning Software Developer
description: Primate Labs, a small (but mighty!) software company located in Toronto, is looking for enthusiastic developers to join our team and help us build Geekbench ML, a machine learning benchmark that measures the performance of popular neural network accelerators.Our diverse customers, from individual consumers to Fortune 500 hardware companies, rely on us to provide applications that produce accurate and unbiased cross-platform performance assessments.The ideal candidate will thrive in an entrepreneurial environment and enjoy working within a small, tight-knit team.ResponsibilitiesAs a Machine Learning Developer, you will be responsible for researching, designing, and developing machine learning benchmark tests to measure the inference performance of neural network accelerators. The benchmark tests use different machine learning frameworks, including TensorFlow Lite and Core ML. The benchmark tests draw from machine learning applications, including object classification, image segmentation, pose estimation, machine translation, and sentiment analysis. In addition to developing the benchmark tests, you will communicate experimental results from the benchmark tests both internally to project stakeholders and externally to representatives from hardware and platform vendors.QualificationsWe're looking for candidates with the following background and skills:An understanding of neural networks and how they work.Experience with at least one machine learning framework (e.g., TensorFlow, Core ML, ONNX).Experience with C++ and Python.Strong verbal and written communication skills.Self-motivated and able to work independently with minimal supervision.An undergraduate degree in a technical field.The following skills are nice to have but by no means necessary:Experience with Java, Objective-C, or Swift.Experience developing for Android or iOS.Compensation and BenefitsPrimate Labs offers a fun and exciting working environment with minimal bureaucracy. Compensation includes a competitive salary, generous vacation time, and medical and dental benefits.This role is a full-time hybrid role in our Toronto office.

title: Senior AI/ML Engineer
description: Company ProfileTTT Studios is a digital innovation studio working for a global client list in multiple industries. Over the past decade, we’ve built multiple applications and patented a portfolio of technologies. This experience has put us in the best position to cater to larger accounts and launch our products. experienced AI & ML Engineer to join our team and work on exciting projects using state-of-the-art technologies such as Language Model LLMs (e.g., GPT-3), chat GPT APIs, cloud infrastructure (e.g., closely with the team to identify and solve complex business problems using machine learning and statistical models.Train and optimize models using cloud infrastructure (e.g., AWS, GCP) and other distributed computing systems.Develop and maintain code repositories, documentation, and data pipelines using version control tools such as Git, and CI/CD tools such as Jenkins or TravisCI.Stay up-to-date with the latest research and trends in AI & ML, and bring new ideas and best practices to the team.RequirementsBachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.5+ years of experience in AI & ML, with a proven track record of developing and deploying models in production environments.Proficiency in Python and related AI & ML libraries, such as TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, and Scikit-learn.Hands-on experience with LLMs (e.g., GPT-3), chat GPT APIs, and other NLP tools and techniques.Strong understanding of cloud infrastructure (e.g., AWS, GCP) and distributed computing systems, such as Kubernetes or Apache Spark.Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work in a team environment and interface with cross-functional teams.If you're passionate about AI & ML and have experience with cutting-edge technologies such as LLMs, chat GPT APIs, cloud infrastructure (e.g., AWS, GCP), and model training (e.g., TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch), we'd love to hear from you. Join our team and work on cutting-edge projects that will shape the future of AI & ML!Hiring ProcessComplete this application and include your CVIf you’re shortlisted, we’ll schedule a video interview with our HR Manager.We will set up an interview at our office or via video conference. We'll talk about your experience, what you think about patterns, architecture, and some everyday situations while developing an app.We’ll schedule a final interview to give more team members a chance to meet youAfter conducting all interviews, we’ll come to a decision.A Day at TTT StudiosOur work culture is second to none. For every project you take on, you’ll encounter intellectually stimulating and impactful challenges that will keep you on your toes. Check out some of our past work here.Our perks include a flexible wellness plan, work flexibility, unlimited vacation, happy hours, Lunch & Learns, yoga and boxing lessons, and a cozy massage chair overlooking Vancouver’s scenic waterfront. The team at TTT is passionate about creating software that makes a positive impact, and management does everything it can to plant the seeds that will propel you to greater heights.More from UsTTT Studios is an award-winning digital innovation studio focused on empowering businesses through technology. We’re ranked #1 in Canada for custom software and mobile application development. Our values are integrity, passion, and excellence. We also strongly believe in empowering the community by being heavily involved in local and international events as speakers, educators, and sponsors. Whether you’re a developer, designer, management, or co-op student, everyone here contributes to who we are as a company.

In this role, you will own our end-to-end Machine Learning platform and core infrastructure, from research to Machine Learning production pipelines. As an ML-Ops Engineer, you’ll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. We deliver digital solutions built to help accelerate the growth of businesses in various industries, by focusing on creating value through innovation.Job Responsibilities:Design and implement large-scale ML systems to support training and serving workloads.Collaborating and share knowledge with our cloud ops team to compress time-to-production for Machine Learning.Build tooling and pipelining abstractions to allow Data scientists to focus on experimentation while empowering self-service workflows to deploy and serve models reliably and consistently.Help Data Scientists produce clean, reproducible, and highly performant machine learning systems through rigorous code review with a lens on software quality.Advocate for automation and monitoring at all steps of ML system construction, and help to define best practices based on personal industry experience and research across the Machine Learning team.Support life cycle management of deployed ML apps (e.g., new releases, change management, monitoring and troubleshooting).Participate in sprint planning, estimations, and reviews.Qualifications:3+ years of software development experience, preferably in Python.Experience with maintaining functional, production reference architectures for end-to-end Machine Learning in cloud.Must have experience with ML-Ops tools and platforms such as Vertex AI, MLFlow and DVC.Strong Linux system administration skills.Experience with declarative infrastructure and Kubernetes (GKE) for model serving and scalable inference.Exposure to automated testing and CI/CD in the ML context.Knowledge of SQL and relational databases, query authoring (SQL) and designing variety of databases (e.g., Postgres SQL).Understanding of fundamental ML concepts.Interest in continually learning and trying new tools.Strong cross-team communication and collaboration skills.We are proud to offer a competitive salary alongside a strong healthcare insurance and benefits package. The role is preferably hybrid, with 2 days per week spent in office. We pride ourselves on the growth of our employees, offering extensive learning and development resources.

title: MLOps Software Engineer
description: Two years ago, we embarked on a journey to start Haven Studios with a small team and big ambitions. Our goal was to build a studio where we could make the kind of games we’ve always wanted to create – and games we’ve longed to play. We are now part of the Playstation Studios family and are building exclusive new IP for Playstation as the first Sony game studio in Canada.We’ve made amazing progress in a short time thanks to our talented, passionate team and their exceptional contributions. We established a culture at Haven grounded in kindness, adaptability and courage that unlocks creativity. Our first new IP for PlayStation is on track to deliver a AAA multiplayer experience with a vision to build a systemic and evolving world focused on freedom, thrill, and playfulness that will keep players entertained and engaged for years.Position - MLOps software engineerWe are looking for an experienced software engineer to join the Generative Machine Learning team at Haven Studios. The ML researchers have been working closely with the game team, and you will play a key role integrating our development with the broader game development pipeline. You will own the architectural design of how we deploy ML to the broader game studio and implementation of necessary systems. You will work closely with the ML researchers and game developers to understand their requirements and build out the infrastructure that matches their needs.ReportingThe MLOps engineer will report to the Director of Generative ML.Responsibilities and DutiesArchitect and implement cloud-native solutions that connect our generative ML technologies to the game (using AWS, GCP)Build CI/CD pipelines to containerize, deploy, version, and monitor our generative modelsImprove development workflows for the ML teamBuild and maintain the REST APIs that expose our ML technology to the development teamExperience and skills requiredCloud platform experience (AWS, GCP, or Azure)Experience architecting, observing, and debugging production distributed systemsExperience with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, Ansible)Experience with container technologies (Docker, Kubernetes)Programming language experience with Python (Go, Rust an asset)Preferred qualificationsGood understanding of Linux and ML frameworks (PyTorch, CUDA )Experience with cloud-based GPUsExperience with distributed training in the cloudComfortable with rapid prototyping, fast iterations—---------Il y a 2 ans, nous nous sommes lancés dans la création de Haven Studios avec une petite équipe et de grandes ambitions. Notre objectif était de construire un studio où nous pourrions créer le genre de jeux que nous avons toujours voulu créer - et auxquels nous avons toujours rêvé de jouer ! Nous faisons désormais partie de la famille PlayStations Studios et nous sommes fiers d'avoir l'opportunité de créer une nouvelle propriété intellectuelle exclusive pour Playstation et de former la première équipe de développement Sony au Canada.Nous avons fait des progrès étonnants en peu de temps grâce à notre équipe talentueuse et passionnée et à ses contributions exceptionnelles. Nous avons instauré chez Haven une culture fondée sur la bienveillance, l'adaptabilité et le courage qui libère la créativité. Notre première nouvelle propriété intellectuelle pour PlayStation est sur la bonne voie pour offrir une expérience multijoueur de niveau AAA, avec la vision de construire un monde systémique et évolutif axé sur la liberté, le frisson et le jeu, qui gardera les joueur·euse·s diverti·e·s et engagé·e·s pendant des années.Poste - Ingénieur·e logiciel MLOpsNous recherchons un·e ingénieur·e logiciel expérimenté·e pour rejoindre l'équipe Machine Learning Génératif chez Haven Studios. Les chercheur·euse·s en ML travaillent en étroite collaboration avec l'équipe de jeu, et vous jouerez un rôle clé dans l'intégration de notre développement avec le pipeline de développement de jeu dans son ensemble. Vous serez responsable de la conception architecturale et de la manière dont nous déployons l'apprentissage automatique dans le studio de jeu ainsi que de l'implémentation des systèmes nécessaires. title: Senior AI/ML Engineer
description: Company ProfileTTT Studios is a digital innovation studio working for a global client list in multiple industries. Over the past decade, we’ve built multiple applications and patented a portfolio of technologies. This experience has put us in the best position to cater to larger accounts and launch our products. Our culture is essential to our company, and we foster an open and welcoming environment for everyone on our team.We understand that success comes from sweating the details. Carefully considered design—whether in our user interface work, technical architectures, or project management processes—is at the core of everything we do. We expect amazing things from each other, and through tight collaboration, we achieve greatness.Candidates must be based in the Vancouver Area.About the Role - Senior AI/ML EngineerWe are seeking an experienced AI & ML Engineer to join our team and work on exciting projects using state-of-the-art technologies such as Language Model LLMs (e.g., GPT-3), chat GPT APIs, cloud infrastructure (e.g., AWS, GCP), and model training (e.g., TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch).ResponsibilitiesDesign and develop AI & ML models using cutting-edge tools and techniques, including LLMs and chat GPT APIs.Work closely with the team to identify and solve complex business problems using machine learning and statistical models.Train and optimize models using cloud infrastructure (e.g., AWS, GCP) and other distributed computing systems.Develop and maintain code repositories, documentation, and data pipelines using version control tools such as Git, and CI/CD tools such as Jenkins or TravisCI.Stay up-to-date with the latest research and trends in AI & ML, and bring new ideas and best practices to the team.RequirementsBachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.5+ years of experience in AI & ML, with a proven track record of developing and deploying models in production environments.Proficiency in Python and related AI & ML libraries, such as TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, and Scikit-learn.Hands-on experience with LLMs (e.g., GPT-3), chat GPT APIs, and other NLP tools and techniques.Strong understanding of cloud infrastructure (e.g., AWS, GCP) and distributed computing systems, such as Kubernetes or Apache Spark.Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work in a team environment and interface with cross-functional teams.If you're passionate about AI & ML and have experience with cutting-edge technologies such as LLMs, chat GPT APIs, cloud infrastructure (e.g., AWS, GCP), and model training (e.g., TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch), we'd love to hear from you. Join our team and work on cutting-edge projects that will shape the future of AI & ML!Hiring ProcessComplete this application and include your CVIf you’re shortlisted, we’ll schedule a video interview with our HR Manager.We will set up an interview at our office or via video conference. We'll talk about your experience, what you think about patterns, architecture, and some everyday situations while developing an app.We’ll schedule a final interview to give more team members a chance to meet youAfter conducting all interviews, we’ll come to a decision.A Day at TTT StudiosOur work culture is second to none. On your first day, you’ll be introduced to the team, and we’ll walk you through our onboarding process to get you set up with the tools we use company-wide. Once settled in, our PM team will get you up to speed with our operations, standards, project pipeline, and client roster. Soon after you’re equipped with the resources and support you’ll need, you’ll be ready to jump into action.Our clients operate across various industries that span professional services, startups, tourism, logistics, e-commerce, and more. For every project you take on, you’ll encounter intellectually stimulating and impactful challenges that will keep you on your toes. Check out some of our past work here.Our perks include a flexible wellness plan, work flexibility, unlimited vacation, happy hours, Lunch & Learns, yoga and boxing lessons, and a cozy massage chair overlooking Vancouver’s scenic waterfront. The team at TTT is passionate about creating software that makes a positive impact, and management does everything it can to plant the seeds that will propel you to greater heights.More from UsTTT Studios is an award-winning digital innovation studio focused on empowering businesses through technology. We’re ranked #1 in Canada for custom software and mobile application development. Our values are integrity, passion, and excellence. We’re obsessed with delivering quality work, which is why our team consists of designers and engineers of the highest calibre. We also strongly believe in empowering the community by being heavily involved in local and international events as speakers, educators, and sponsors. Whether you’re a developer, designer, management, or co-op student, everyone here contributes to who we are as a company.

title: ML-Ops Engineer
description: Position Overview:ShyftLabs is searching for an ML-Ops Engineer to join our expanding team. In this role, you will own our end-to-end Machine Learning platform and core infrastructure, from research to Machine Learning production pipelines. As an ML-Ops Engineer, you’ll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. You should be self-directed and comfortable implementing training and inference pipelines in collaboration with a wide range of stakeholders and cross-functional teams. As an ideal candidate, you need to have a strong background in Machine Learning and software development. Must have Vertex AI experience.ShyftLabs is a growing data product company that was founded in early 2020, and works primarily with Fortune 500 companies. We deliver digital solutions built to help accelerate the growth of businesses in various industries, by focusing on creating value through innovation.Job Responsibilities:Design and implement large-scale ML systems to support training and serving workloads.Collaborating and share knowledge with our cloud ops team to compress time-to-production for Machine Learning.Build tooling and pipelining abstractions to allow Data scientists to focus on experimentation while empowering self-service workflows to deploy and serve models reliably and consistently.Help Data Scientists produce clean, reproducible, and highly performant machine learning systems through rigorous code review with a lens on software quality.Advocate for automation and monitoring at all steps of ML system construction, and help to define best practices based on personal industry experience and research across the Machine Learning team.Support life cycle management of deployed ML apps (e.g., new releases, change management, monitoring and troubleshooting).Participate in sprint planning, estimations, and reviews.Qualifications:3+ years of software development experience, preferably in Python.Experience with maintaining functional, production reference architectures for end-to-end Machine Learning in cloud.Must have experience with ML-Ops tools and platforms such as Vertex AI, MLFlow and DVC.Strong Linux system administration skills.Experience with declarative infrastructure and Kubernetes (GKE) for model serving and scalable inference.Exposure to automated testing and CI/CD in the ML context.Knowledge of SQL and relational databases, query authoring (SQL) and designing variety of databases (e.g., Postgres SQL).Understanding of fundamental ML concepts.Interest in continually learning and trying new tools.Strong cross-team communication and collaboration skills.We are proud to offer a competitive salary alongside a strong healthcare insurance and benefits package. The role is preferably hybrid, with 2 days per week spent in office. We pride ourselves on the growth of our employees, offering extensive learning and development resources.

title: CRM Data Scientist
description: Browns Shoes, a family-owned business established in Montreal in 1940, now with 70 stores across Canada, is synonymous with top international designer collections, luxurious leather goods, and exclusive street savvy fashion for ladies, men, and children.Browns is seeking a highly skilled and experienced customer database analyst to execute data science projects within our growing marketing team. As a CRM Data Scientist, reporting to the Director of CRM & Loyalty, you will be responsible for analysing and interpreting customer data to identify key insights, trends and relationships that can be used to improve our marketing segmentation strategies and boost overall cross-channel customer engagement.The ideal candidate will have a strong interest in building actionable data models to predict customer behaviour and testing our theories in a live business context to provide the best possible personalized experience for our customers.Responsibilities:Work with the marketing team to identify key business questions that can be addressed using data analysis and statistical modelling.Conduct in-depth analyses of customer data to create and validate audience segmentation based on user demographics, purchase behaviour, tastes, and preferences.Develop and implement predictive models to forecast customer behaviour and to identify customer trends and patterns, including customer lifetime value and churn analysis.Collaborate with cross-functional marketing teams to provide data-driven insights and recommendations to optimize the cross-channel customer journey.Design and develop dashboards and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders.Collaborate with internal BI and Tech teams as the key “customer” of raw centralized data structures: operationalizing it to drive customer-facing action and to support marketing decision-making.Requirements:Bachelor’s or master’s degree in data science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.3+ years of experience in data analysis and statistical modelling.Proficiency with SQL queries and data analysis tools such as R and Python.Proficiency with CDP platforms such as Twillo Segment, Emarsys and Tealium; experience with Snowflake, AWS or BigQuery a plus.Proficiency with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker and PowerBI.Knowledge of marketing segmentation techniques and customer database analysis.Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills, with the ability to communicate complex technical information clearly.Ability to work independently on complex analytical projects with attention to detail and strong documentation practices.While we appreciate your interest in this role, please note that only selected candidates will be contacted.Thank you for your interest in BrownsChaussures Browns, une entreprise familiale fondée à Montréal en 1940, détient maintenant 70 boutiques partout au Canada. Nous offrons les meilleures marques internationales, des articles luxueux en cuir et des tendances urbaines exclusives pour hommes, femmes et enfants.Browns est à la recherche d'un analyste de base de données clients hautement qualifié et expérimenté pour exécuter des projets de science des données dans le cadre de notre équipe marketing en pleine croissance. En tant que Scientifique des données CRM, sous la responsabilité du Directeur CRM & loyauté, vous serez chargé d'analyser et d'interpréter les données clients afin d'identifier les informations clés, les tendances et les relations qui peuvent être utilisées pour améliorer nos stratégies de segmentation marketing et stimuler l'engagement global des clients à travers les différents canaux.Le candidat idéal doit s'intéresser fortement à l'élaboration de modèles de données exploitables pour prédire le comportement des clients et tester nos théories dans un contexte commercial réel afin d'offrir la meilleure expérience personnalisée possible à nos clients.Responsabilités:Travailler avec l'équipe de marketing pour identifier les questions commerciales clés qui peuvent être traitées à l'aide de l'analyse des données et de la modélisation statistique.Effectuer des analyses approfondies des données relatives aux clients afin de créer et de valider la segmentation du public en fonction des caractéristiques démographiques des utilisateurs, de leur comportement d'achat, de leurs goûts et de leurs préférences.Développer et mettre en œuvre des modèles prédictifs pour prévoir le comportement des clients et pour identifier les tendances et les modèles des clients, y compris la valeur de la durée de vie des clients et l'analyse du taux de désabonnement.Collaborer avec les équipes marketing interfonctionnelles pour fournir des informations et des recommandations basées sur des données afin d'optimiser le parcours client multicanal.Concevoir et développer des tableaux de bord et des rapports pour communiquer des informations aux parties prenantes.Collaborer avec les équipes BI et technologiques internes en tant que "client" clé des structures de données brutes centralisées : les rendre opérationnelles pour mener des actions en contact avec les clients et pour soutenir la prise de décision en matière de marketing.Exigences:Baccalauréat ou maîtrise en science des données, en statistiques, en mathématiques, en informatique ou dans un domaine connexe.3+ ans d'expérience dans l'analyse de données et la modélisation statistique.Maîtrise des requêtes SQL et des outils d'analyse de données tels que R et Python.Maîtrise des plateformes CDP telles que Twillo Segment, Emarsys et Tealium ; expérience avec Snowflake, AWS ou BigQuery un plus.Maîtrise des outils de visualisation de données tels que Tableau, Looker et PowerBI.Connaissance des techniques de segmentation marketing et de l'analyse des bases de données clients.Solides compétences en matière de résolution de problèmes et de réflexion critique, avec la capacité de communiquer clairement des informations techniques complexes.Capacité à travailler de manière autonome sur des projets analytiques complexes, avec un souci du détail et de solides pratiques de documentation.Nous avons hâte de recevoir votre candidature ; notez que nous communiquerons seulement avec les personnes retenues.Merci de l’intérêt que vous portez à Browns

title: Data Scientist/Analyst
description: The Hub Program at Client is modernizing its data reporting by improving user experience and introducing internal efficiencies, including the automation of indicator methodology calculations.Our Client's disclosures of health information are made at the highest degree of anonymity possible while still meeting the research and/or analytical purposes. Client publicly releases aggregated data in a manner designed to minimize any risk of re-identification and residual disclosure.Client is endeavouring to automate complex statistical disclosure controls (e.g. small cell-size suppression) to reduce the burden of their manual application, thereby introducing internal efficiencies and improve the timeliness of our reporting.ServicesAssess three statistical disclosure control tools (G-Confid, Tau-Argus and sdcTable) for their ability to meet Client's need to automate statistical disclosure control techniques (e.g. primary and complementary cell suppressions, rounding, etc) for a variety of multi-dimensional, linked and hierarchical aggregate data tables sourcing clinical databases and survey data, with the goal of minimizing disclosure risk while maximizing information utility. Conduct a proof of concept demonstrating the tools' features and capabilities using a variety of aggregate Client data tables, while highlighting how each of the tools could fit into operational data production processes.Write a report summarizing the findings and recommend which among these tools would best meet Client needs. Create plain-language documentation to support the application of preferred disclosure control techniques to aggregate data sets using the recommended tool. Knowledge transfer to support ongoing in-house operational application of the preferred statistical disclosure control techniques for future data releases.Skill or Knowledge Skill Required Skill Level *(Intermediate or Senior) COTS Configuration/Development SAS Macro Yes Intermediate SAS Programming Yes Intermediate Big Data Python Yes Intermediate R Yes Intermediate Leadership / Business Skills Analysis Yes Intermediate CIHI Business Understanding Yes Industry Best Practices/ Trends Yes Intermediate Problem-Solving Yes Senior Process Automation Yes Senior Verbal Communication Yes Intermediate Workflow Design Yes Intermediate Written Communication Yes Intermediate Coaching/ Mentoring Yes Intermediate Other G-Confid Yes Intermediate Tau-Argus Yes Intermediate sdcTable Yes Intermediate

title: Data Scientist
description: Position Overview:Here at ShyftLabs, we are searching for an experienced Data Scientist who can derive performance improvement and cost efficiency in our product through a deep understanding of the ML and infra system, and provide a data driven insight and scientific solution.ShyftLabs is a growing data product company that was founded in early 2020, and works primarily with Fortune 500 companies. We deliver digital solutions built to help accelerate the growth of businesses in various industries, by focusing on creating value through innovation.Job Responsibilities:Data Analysis and research: analyzing a large dataset with queries and scripts, extracting valuable signals out of noise, and producing actionable insights into how we could complete and improve a complex ML and bidding system.Simulation and Modelling: validating and quantifying the efficiency and performance gain from hypotheses through rigorous simulation and modelling.Experimentation and Causal Inference: developing a robust experiment design and metric framework, and providing reliable and unbiased insights for product and business decision making.Qualifications:Master's degree in a quantitative discipline or equivalent.3+ years minimum professional experience.Distinctive problem-solving skills, good at articulating product questions, pulling data from large datasets and using statistics to arrive at a recommendation.Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with ability to present information and analysis results effectively.Ability to build positive relationships within ShyftLabs and with our stakeholders, and work effectively with cross-functional partners in a global company.Statistics: must have strong knowledge and experience in experimental design, hypothesis testing, and various statistical analysis techniques such as regression or linear models.Machine Learning: must have deep understanding of ML algorithms (i.e. deep learning, random forest, gradient boosted trees, k-means clustering, etc.) and its development, validation, and evaluation.Programming: experience with Python, R or other scripting language, and database language (e.g. SQL) or data manipulation (e.g. Pandas).We are proud to offer a competitive salary alongside a strong healthcare insurance and benefits package. The role is preferably hybrid, with 2 days per week spent in office. We pride ourselves on the growth of our employees, offering extensive learning and development resources.

title: Data Scientist
description: Competition # : 38823Department: Health and WellnessLocation: HALIFAXType of Employment: PermanentUnion Status:  Exclusion - Non Union - NSPGClosing Date: 5/5/2023 ( Applications are accepted until 11:59 PM Atlantic Time)About UsThe Department of Health and Wellness offers opportunities to grow and advance in a dynamic sector that touches the lives of all Nova Scotians. Along with our partners, including Nova Scotia Health and the IWK Health Centre, we’re committed to continually improving our health care system. With a focus on collaborative primary health care, continuing care, improved supports for mental health and addictions, digital health, capital infrastructure, and more, the department is thinking differently about how to plan, fund, legislate and monitor to improve access and service delivery. To do this, we need leaders at all levels of the organization who embrace a challenge and believe in their ability to make a difference.About Our OpportunityThe Department of Health and Wellness is expanding its policy development and strategic planning capacity through an increased use of advanced analytics to drive insight and to incorporate a broader use of varied data resources. This position will take a leadership role in expanding the Department’s capabilities in this area, with a particular focus on health economics.Primary AccountabilitiesReporting to the Director of Analytics, you will work with a dynamic, collegial and committed team that provides analytical and applied research services to ensure capacity for driving change. You will lead data-driven projects, applying advanced econometric and analytical methodologies at every stage: data exploration, design and evaluation of methods and models; and communicate results to internal and external stakeholders.You will strengthen the use of advanced econometrics to inform strategic planning and policy development, responding to the health needs of Nova Scotians and aligning with the overall strategic vision and mission of the Department.You will expand not only the Department’s capabilities, but advance strategy on data analytics, and the use of new sources of information. You will use advanced analytics technologies to leverage structured and unstructured data from a variety of internal and external sources. You will find creative ways to develop tools and services that drive innovation.As a Data Scientist, You Will Also Act as a subject matter expert in the areas of economic data science, advanced analytics, econometric methods, and new analytics technologies  Apply, adapt and design computational architectures and approaches for the statistical analysis of health data  Leverage extensive theoretical and practical knowledge of advanced analytic methods and algorithms  Keep current with industry and academic developments  Apply data visualization techniques to present the results of statistical analysis  Play a key role in applied health economic research projects linked to the provincial health system  Support the development of a broader health economics strategy and capability in collaboration with internal stakeholders and external partners  Work in collaboration with Analytics Team members, seeking and providing feedback on work under development.  Work with a team of analysts to foster their professional development.. Qualifications And ExperienceA completed Master’s degree or Ph.D. in economics or a related discipline such as computer science, mathematics, or statistics with at least 5 years of recent relevant experience related to economics, including experience leading project teams.An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered. Applicants relying on education and experience equivalencies must demonstrate such equivalencies in their application.We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist, specialized in econometrics, who has excellent analytical research and problem-solving skills, enjoys working in an innovation environment, and is a self-starter.As a Successful Data Scientist (Economics), You Are an effective communicator who can share and adapt information and ideas to the target audience, using clear and compelling written and oral communication skills;  Possess knowledge and experience in collecting, organizing and manipulating large data sets;  Have hands-on experience with statistical and quantitative analysis, scientific programming languages and libraries, and data visualization tools.  Are able to demonstrate your experience with advanced analytics projects, including designing methodologies, conducting analysis and interpreting results. Considered An Asset If You Have Knowledge of health systems, health economics, health policy, and/or population health The Government of Nova Scotia has adopted the LEADS Leadership Framework. During the interview, candidates will be expected to express how they have demonstrated the key behaviours and capabilities required to effectively lead in a caring and inclusive environment. LEADS Domains includes Leads Self, Engage Others, Achieve Results, Develop Coalitions and Systems Transformation.Please follow LEADS (novascotia.ca) for more information.We will assess the above qualifications and competencies using one or more of the following tools: written examination, standardized tests, oral presentations, interview(s), and reference checks.EquivalencyAn equivalent combination of training, education and experience will be considered. Applicants relying on education and experience equivalencies must demonstrate such equivalencies in their application.Benefitsthe Government of Nova Scotia offers its employees a wide range of benefits such as Health, Dental, Life Insurance, Pension, General Illness (Short and Long Term), Vacation and Employee and Family Assistance Programs. Click here to learn more about our various benefits offerings and eligibility criteria.What We Offer Career Development where you have access to career guidance, tools, resources, and ongoing training for every stage of your career.  Engaging workplace. Our Employees feel valued, respected, connected, and tuned in. We have forward-thinking policies and strategies.  Countless Career Paths.  Department Specific Flexible working schedules. Pay Grade: EC 13Salary Range: $3,804.02 - $4,755.01 Bi-WeeklyEmployment Equity StatementOur goal is to be a diverse workforce that is representative, at all job levels, of the citizens we serve. The Government of Nova Scotia has an Employment Equity Policy, and we welcome applications from Indigenous People, African Nova Scotians and Other Racially Visible Persons, Persons with Disabilities and Women in occupations or positions where they are under-represented. If you are a member of one of these equity groups, you are encouraged to self-identify on your electronic application.Current government employees may access this posting through the link below:Offer of employment is conditional upon the completion of all applicable background checks and confirmation of credentials, the results of which must be satisfactory to the employer. We thank all applicants for the interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. All questions and concerns may be directed to Competitions@novascotia.ca.

title: CRM Data Scientist
description: Browns Shoes, a family-owned business established in Montreal in 1940, now with 70 stores across Canada, is synonymous with top international designer collections, luxurious leather goods, and exclusive street savvy fashion for ladies, men, and children.Browns is seeking a highly skilled and experienced customer database analyst to execute data science projects within our growing marketing team. As a CRM Data Scientist, reporting to the Director of CRM & Loyalty, you will be responsible for analysing and interpreting customer data to identify key insights, trends and relationships that can be used to improve our marketing segmentation strategies and boost overall cross-channel customer engagement.The ideal candidate will have a strong interest in building actionable data models to predict customer behaviour and testing our theories in a live business context to provide the best possible personalized experience for our customers.Responsibilities:Work with the marketing team to identify key business questions that can be addressed using data analysis and statistical modelling.Conduct in-depth analyses of customer data to create and validate audience segmentation based on user demographics, purchase behaviour, tastes, and preferences.Develop and implement predictive models to forecast customer behaviour and to identify customer trends and patterns, including customer lifetime value and churn analysis.Collaborate with cross-functional marketing teams to provide data-driven insights and recommendations to optimize the cross-channel customer journey.Design and develop dashboards and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders.Collaborate with internal BI and Tech teams as the key “customer” of raw centralized data structures: operationalizing it to drive customer-facing action and to support marketing decision-making.Requirements:Bachelor’s or master’s degree in data science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.3+ years of experience in data analysis and statistical modelling.Proficiency with SQL queries and data analysis tools such as R and Python.Proficiency with CDP platforms such as Twillo Segment, Emarsys and Tealium; experience with Snowflake, AWS or BigQuery a plus.Proficiency with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker and PowerBI.Knowledge of marketing segmentation techniques and customer database analysis.Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills, with the ability to communicate complex technical information clearly.Ability to work independently on complex analytical projects with attention to detail and strong documentation practices.While we appreciate your interest in this role, please note that only selected candidates will be contacted.Thank you for your interest in BrownsChaussures Browns, une entreprise familiale fondée à Montréal en 1940, détient maintenant 70 boutiques partout au Canada. Nous offrons les meilleures marques internationales, des articles luxueux en cuir et des tendances urbaines exclusives pour hommes, femmes et enfants.Browns est à la recherche d'un analyste de base de données clients hautement qualifié et expérimenté pour exécuter des projets de science des données dans le cadre de notre équipe marketing en pleine croissance. En tant que Scientifique des données CRM, sous la responsabilité du Directeur CRM & loyauté, vous serez chargé d'analyser et d'interpréter les données clients afin d'identifier les informations clés, les tendances et les relations qui peuvent être utilisées pour améliorer nos stratégies de segmentation marketing et stimuler l'engagement global des clients à travers les différents canaux.Le candidat idéal doit s'intéresser fortement à l'élaboration de modèles de données exploitables pour prédire le comportement des clients et tester nos théories dans un contexte commercial réel afin d'offrir la meilleure expérience personnalisée possible à nos clients.Responsabilités:Travailler avec l'équipe de marketing pour identifier les questions commerciales clés qui peuvent être traitées à l'aide de l'analyse des données et de la modélisation statistique.Effectuer des analyses approfondies des données relatives aux clients afin de créer et de valider la segmentation du public en fonction des caractéristiques démographiques des utilisateurs, de leur comportement d'achat, de leurs goûts et de leurs préférences.Développer et mettre en œuvre des modèles prédictifs pour prévoir le comportement des clients et pour identifier les tendances et les modèles des clients, y compris la valeur de la durée de vie des clients et l'analyse du taux de désabonnement.Collaborer avec les équipes marketing interfonctionnelles pour fournir des informations et des recommandations basées sur des données afin d'optimiser le parcours client multicanal.Concevoir et développer des tableaux de bord et des rapports pour communiquer des informations aux parties prenantes.Collaborer avec les équipes BI et technologiques internes en tant que "client" clé des structures de données brutes centralisées : les rendre opérationnelles pour mener des actions en contact avec les clients et pour soutenir la prise de décision en matière de marketing.Exigences:Baccalauréat ou maîtrise en science des données, en statistiques, en mathématiques, en informatique ou dans un domaine connexe.3+ ans d'expérience dans l'analyse de données et la modélisation statistique.Maîtrise des requêtes SQL et des outils d'analyse de données tels que R et Python.Maîtrise des plateformes CDP telles que Twillo Segment, Emarsys et Tealium ; expérience avec Snowflake, AWS ou BigQuery un plus.Maîtrise des outils de visualisation de données tels que Tableau, Looker et PowerBI.Connaissance des techniques de segmentation marketing et de l'analyse des bases de données clients.Solides compétences en matière de résolution de problèmes et de réflexion critique, avec la capacité de communiquer clairement des informations techniques complexes.Capacité à travailler de manière autonome sur des projets analytiques complexes, avec un souci du détail et de solides pratiques de documentation.Nous avons hâte de recevoir votre candidature ; notez que nous communiquerons seulement avec les personnes retenues.Merci de l’intérêt que vous portez à Browns

a truly market differentiated product suite.You will join a collaborative but highly autonomous working environment in which each member has a defined role with clear expectations, as well as the is a plusStrong problem-solving, communication, and collaboration skills

expertise.Data ETL and processing experience.Data Automation Skills And Experience.Experience and expertise on advanced analytic techniques such as machine learning, predictive modelling, and logistic regression.Experience in advertising effectiveness analysis, marketing mix modelling, multi-touch attribution and ROI measurement.Working knowledge of media planning/buying and campaign management is Acquire, explore, analyze, visualize, cleanse, and transform large sets of data from various external or internal sources. Experience Minimum three (3) years of experience in building models and developing algorithms for optimization, machine learning, statistics, mathematical programming, and simulation in industry or academia.  Expertise in Mixed Integer Programming, Linear Programming, and Constrained Optimization.  Very good proficiency in Python and hands-on skills in SQL  A demonstrated ability in Data Science or Operations Research, derived from hands-on experience working on multiple projects.  Deep understanding of statistics and probability, quantitative sciences, data analysis, predictive, statistical and ML modeling  End-to-end experience with data, including querying, aggregation, analysis, and visualization.  Strong problem-solving and communication skills; a bias towards taking action quickly, making things happen, learning and correcting course as you receive feedback  Analytical Skills – Effectively researches and synthesizes complex or diverse information; uses intuition and experience to complement data and designs work flows and procedures.  Judgment – Displays willingness to make timely decisions, including appropriate people in the decision-making process and exhibits sound and accurate judgment; supports and explains reasoning for decisions  Planning/Organizing – Prioritizes and plans work activities effectively. Ability to multi-task.  Teamwork – Balances team and individual responsibilities; Exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views, giving and welcoming feedback. Puts success of team above own interests and demonstrates ability to build morale and group commitments to goals and objectives. Supports everyone's efforts to succeed.  Innovation – Displays original thinking and creativity and meets challenges with resourcefulness. Generates suggestions for improving work. Presents ideas and information in a manner that gets others' agreement.  Communication Skills – Able to clearly communicate ideas and expectations. Effectively listens for understanding and asks questions for clarification. Presents ideas effectively in both verbal and written form.  Interpersonal Skills – Approachable and easy to talk to. Relates well to all kinds of people in the organization. Able to effectively build rapport with others. Uses diplomacy and tact. Maintains composure and shows an ability to resolve conflicts and gain agreement. About Environics Analytics Environics Analytics (EA) is a marketing services company specializing in geodemographic-based segmentation, site evaluation modelling, and custom analytics.  EA is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. If you require any accommodation to participate in the hiring process, please note the request in your application. We welcome people of all abilities.  At EA, you will solve meaningful and challenging tasks with a friendly team of the most brilliant minds. We hire personality, not just a pair of hands. title: Data Scientist I
description: IGT (NYSE:IGT) is a global leader in gaming. We deliver entertaining and responsible gaming experiences for players across all channels and regulated segments, from Lotteries and Gaming Machines to Sports Betting and Digital. Leveraging a wealth of compelling content, substantial investment in innovation, player insights, operational expertise, and leading-edge technology, our solutions deliver unrivaled gaming experiences that engage players and drive growth. We have a well-established local presence and relationships with governments and regulators in more than 100 countries around the world, and create value by adhering to the highest standards of service, integrity, and responsibility. IGT has approximately 10,500 employees. For more information, please visit www.igt.com .Over viewIGT’s Center of Data Excellence is seeking a Data Scientist to research, design, and build innovative Analytics and Machine Learning (ML) solutions for the gaming industry. Working in close collaboration with our team of Data Engineers and Scientists, this role will also work in close collaboration with various business units to support data needs and data governance across many areas of IGT. It will have a large impact by performing innovative research studies and taking a hands-on, collaborative approach to implement the resulting outcomes.Responsibilities Work closely with other Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and Data Owners to gain a high understanding of our gaming related data and business objectives  Manipulate and optimize large volumes of data from a variety of sources.  Work within a cloud-based infrastructure (AWS or Azure or Google Cloud and Snowflake)  Turn data into valuable and actionable insights.  Work collaboratively to identify highest value target areas to apply advanced analytics, statistical modeling, data mining and to help research new predictive models, scoring algorithms, and other analytical methods  Design, implement, and test statistical algorithms into production warehouses and reports  Responsibilities include working with various business units and cloud accounts, managing, and optimizing data retrieval, administration and automation  Partner with software developers to design, implement, and test analytically-sound software and user interfaces Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in computer science, applied math, computer engineering, or related field with Specific courses in data engineering, data science, and/or data analysis.  Drive and enthusiasm for data science, cloud technologies, AI analysis & modeling tools, and/or machine learning. Willing to try new things and help build a data management framework.  Strong math skills, analytics, statistics, and ability to deal with anomalies are essential  An understanding of business - specifically knowledge of gaming industry is considered an asset  Experience with Python, SQL, snowflake, AWS Sagemaker, Jupyter notebooks, data ingestion, data management, data modeling, documentation, data governance and/or data analytics  Experience with MS products preferred.  Experience with data manipulation and SQL and tools such as Hadoop, Kafka, and Spark……  Working knowledge of expert data mining, machine learning and predictive modeling skills such as decision trees, Markov chains, regressions, time series analysis, CNN  Exposure to or experience working with big data warehouses that can run Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) processes on top of big data sets using cloud-based infrastructure such as AWS or Azure or Google Cloud or Snowflake.  Experience working with software development teams is a plus Keys to Success Building collaborative relationships Decision making Drive results Foster innovation Personal energy Self-leadershipIGT is committed to sustaining a workforce that reflects the diversity of the global customers and communities we serve, creating a fair and inclusive culture that enables all our employees to feel valued, respected and engaged. IGT is an equal opportunity employer. We provide equal opportunities without regard to sex, race, color, religion, age, national origin or ancestry, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information, gender identity or expression, marital or family status, and any other personal attributes protected by federal, provincial or other laws. We thank all applicants for applying; however, only those selected to interview will be contacted.IGT (NYSE: IGT) is the global leader in gaming. For more information, please visit www.igt.com .
